document_title: [FortiOS] httpsd crashes when an authenticated user sends a malformed request

note.text: A Stack-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability in the HTTPD daemon of FortiOS may allow an authenticated remote attacker to crash the service by sending a malformed PUT request to the server. Fortinet is not aware of any successful exploitation of this vulnerability that would lead to code execution.
note.title: Summary

note.text: FortiOS versions 6.0.10 and below.FortiOS versions 6.2.2 and below.
note.title: Affected Products

note.text: Please upgrade to FortiGate version 6.0.11 or above. Please upgrade to FortiGate version 6.2.3 or above. Please upgrade to FortiGate version 6.4.0 or above.
note.title: Solutions

acknowledgment.description: Fortinet is pleased to thank Cody Sixteen ( https://code610.blogspot.com/) for reporting this issue under responsible disclosure.
